Eric Schmidt is stepping down as CEO of Google, and Larry Page is taking over the company just announced in its earnings release. Eric Schmidt will become Executive Chairman focused on, deals, partnerships, customers and broader business relationships, government outreach and technology thought leadership, the company says. Google's other cofounder, Sergey Brin will take a more active role in strategic projects including product. The change is effective starting April 4, 2011.

NFL Commissioner Roger Goodell presented the Pete Roselle trophy to him this morning. After accepting it, Aaron Rodgers talked about the journey that led him to the Super Bowl and a Championship win. Finally getting an opportunity and making the most of it, and this was another opportunity last night, they don't come around that often, i just wanted to make the most of it, we did as a team, a great team win, a great group of guys in the locker room, just really excited to be a part of it, said Aaron Rodgers . , who revealed her Glee character Sue Sylvester is inspired by Simon Cowell . However, becoming a parent was a big step for Jane Lynch , 50- who admits she always preferred animals to children! to speed up decision-making at the Internet giant. In a regulatory filing last week, Google Inc. said that Eric Schmidt in December drew up a plan to sell some of his stock in the company. The pre-arranged trading plan was adopted in order to allow Eric Schmidt to sell a portion of his Google Inc. stock as part of his long-term strategy for individual asset diversification and liquidity, the filing said. As of Dec. 31, Eric Schmidt had about 9.2 million shares of Google Inc. stock and controlled 9.6 percent of the company's voting power. Eric Schmidt plans to sell about 534,000 shares of Class

cuts were dealt a blow today after six councils won their High Court challenge over Michael Gove 's decision to scrap school building projects in different parts of the country. In five of the cases the failure was so unfair as to amount to an abuse of power, the judge said.
